item.title: Brian add a quote by S. Gudder
item.description: "The essence of mathematics is not to make simple things complicated but to make complicated things simple." -- S. Gudder

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Pure mathematics is in its way the poetry of logical ideas." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Euclid
item.description: "There is no Royal Road to Geometry." -- Euclid

item.title: Brian add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled." -- Plutarch

item.title: Brian add a quote by Sophia Kovalevskaya
item.description: "It is impossible to be a mathematician without being a poet in soul." -- Sophia Kovalevskaya

item.title: Brian add a quote by Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi
item.description: "The object of mathematics is the honor of the human spirit." -- Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Proclus
item.description: "Wherever there is number, there is beauty. " -- Proclus

item.title: Brian add a quote by Pythagoras
item.description: "There is geometry in the humming of the string." -- Pythagoras

item.title: Brian add a quote by Karl Weierstrass
item.description: "A mathematician who is not also something of a poet will never be a complete mathematician." -- Karl Weierstrass

item.title: Brian add a quote by Alfred North Whitehead
item.description: "We think in generalities, but we live in detail. To make the past live, we must perceive it in detail in addition to thinking of it in generalities." -- Alfred North Whitehead

item.title: Brian add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The best teacher is not the one who knows most but the one who is most capable of reducing knowledge to that simple compound of the obvious and wonderful." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Brian add a quote by John Wesley Young
item.description: "It is clear that the chief end of mathematical study must be to make the students think." -- John Wesley Young

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Henri Poincare
item.description: "The mathematician does not study pure mathematics because it is useful; he studies it because he delights in it and he delights in it because it is beautiful." -- Henri Poincare

item.title: Brian add a quote by George Polya
item.description: "Beauty in mathematics is seeing the truth without effort." -- George Polya

item.title: Brian add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "We only think when confronted with a problem." -- John Dewey

item.title: Brian add a quote by Jean Dieudonne
item.description: "The life of a mathematician is dominated by an insatiable curiosity, a desire bordering on passion to solve the problems he is studying." -- Jean Dieudonne

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albrecht Durer
item.description: "Geometry is the foundation of all painting." -- Albrecht Durer

item.title: Brian add a quote by Peter J. Hilton
item.description: "Mathematics should be fun." -- Peter J. Hilton

item.title: Brian add a quote by ROBERT FROST
item.description: "I am not a teacher, but an awakener." -- ROBERT FROST

item.title: Brian add a quote by Galileo
item.description: "Philosophy [nature] is written in that great book which ever is before our eyes -- I mean the universe -- but we cannot understand it if we do not first learn the language and grasp the symbols in which it is written. The book is written in mathematical language, and the symbols are triangles, circles and other geometrical figures, without whose help it is impossible to comprehend a single word of it; without which one wanders in vain through a dark labyrinth." -- Galileo

item.title: Brian add a quote by Nathanael West
item.description: "Numbers constitute the only universal language." -- Nathanael West

item.title: Brian add a quote by Georg Cantor
item.description: "The essence of mathematics is in its freedom." -- Georg Cantor

item.title: Brian add a quote by Alfred Whitehead
item.description: "From the very beginning of his education, the child should experience the joy of discovery." -- Alfred Whitehead

item.title: Brian add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "Our greatest national resource is the minds of our children." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Brian add a quote by Augustus De Morgan
item.description: "The moving power of mathematical invention is not reasoning but imagination." -- Augustus De Morgan

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Since the mathematicians have invaded the theory of relativity I do not understand it myself any more." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Jaime Escalante
item.description: "We are all concerned about the future of American education. But as I tell my students, you do not enter the future -- you create the future. The future is created through hard work." -- Jaime Escalante
